meanings.definition: Having only a small amount of hair on the head.
meanings.sent1: The man with a semibald head wore a hat to protect his scalp from the sun.
meanings.sent2: She noticed her semibald reflection in the mirror and decided to try a new hairstyle.
meanings.sent3: The semibald cat looked quite funny with its patchy fur and bald spots.
meanings.sent4: His semibald appearance made him stand out in a crowd like a lone tree in a field.
meanings.sent5: The semibald mountain peak was covered in patches of snow, resembling a balding head.

meanings.sent1: The semibald eagle soared majestically in the sky, its feathers glistening in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: As he aged, his hairline receded, leaving him semibald at the crown of his head.
meanings.sent3: The semibald tree had lost many of its leaves, giving it a unique and sparse appearance.
meanings.sent4: Her semibald garden had patches of grass peeking through the soil, creating a balding effect.
meanings.sent5: The semibald hill stood out in the landscape, resembling a bald spot on the earth's surface.
